page.title: 04THE SHOPPING CENTRE-BEDWORTH
page.content: Bedworth{TOWN CENTRE}was redesigned in the 1970's.It is now a traffic-free zone. Multi-national chainstores such as Woolworth,Boots & W.H.Smith are represented,together with a large Co-op store & 2 national superstores (Tesco & Fine Fare).Tesco finances its own bus,bringing shoppers from Nuneaton,Coventry & the surrounding area to shop at its store.Bedworth has a permanent{OPEN MARKET}(64 stalls) trading Tuesdays(08.30-1300)& Fridays (08.30-1700).27 stalls sell clothes,13 sell food & the rest sell a variety of things.The rent is paid to the council weekly.The stallholders usually arrive between 06.00 & 07.00 & bring their stock in vans.{ {CAR PARKING FACILITIES}close to the town centre include 2 multi storeys attached to the superstores & 3 Pay & Display car parks.
